column4: hi guys, i'm considering switching to ubuntu, so I'd like to split my disk, what tool do you recommend to resize partitions?
also will the ubuntu installer just use the empty space on my drive?
nice, thanks for the info jim_p
thing is I don't know a lot about the different file system types and how I should set it up, any links for that?
and mgolisch, I'm always backed up ;-)
ext3 is a good start  add a sep /home is another
Please post a description of the problem along with your link
problem was posted couple of minutes ago, parted says "can't have partition outside the disk"
your size is over the size of the drive by 2
255 heads, 63 sectors/track, 18241 cylinders  and  you are trying  /dev/sdb1   *           1       18242
is that the number of blocks you are talking about? how could i fix it
great :-) is there a way to do it safely then?
with what? parted doesn't recognize any partition
since this isnt a   ubuntu support issue you will need to find some tools that can do it.. there is nothing we have other than basic editor
